goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata (pdf 894kB)
graph_title: Youth not in employment and not education or training
indicator_name: Proportion of youth (aged 15–24 years) not in education, employment or training
indicator_definition: This indicator is defined as the percentage of young persons (aged 15-24 years) not in education, employment or training, out of the total youth population. It is also called the ‘youth NEET rate’.
target: By 2020, substantially reduce the proportion of youth not in employment, education or training
title: Youth not in employment and not education or training
source_organisation_1: National Institute of Statistics of Rwanda (NISR)
page_content: In Labour Force Survey the age of youth started on 16 years instead of being 15 years as defined in global definition.
